p: Using parametric models of R y as described by Eqs ( 7) and ( 8), we examined if observed proportions were biased by time-dependent artefact (e.g. caused by the time-dependent change in the laboratory diagnostic method). Considering that R y could be described only by the step function dividing the overall time-dependent pattern into those before and during 2006/07 season and afterwards, AIC values of scenario 1, 2 and 3 were 542.5, 3774.4 and 8793.5, respectively ( Fig 5). If we additionally account for the linearly increasing time trend in R y, the AIC was calculated at 480.7, 3728.9 and 8782.8, respectively, for scenarios 1, 2 and 3. Namely, the model fit was always better for R y that combines step function (separating before and after 2007) with linear trend than R y with step function only.
